publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6260 Pauline McNeill: Congratulations to Turner Prize Nominee Susan Philipsz—That the Parliament congratulates artist Susan Philipsz on her nomination for this year’s Turner Prize; recognises that she is one of four artists in the running for the 2010 award; notes that her work, Lowlands, commissioned for the Glasgow International Festival of Visual Art, is a new site-specific outdoor sound work played on the banks of the River Clyde, and wishes the Glasgow-born artist every success for the competition.

S3M-6260Pauline McNeill:Congratulations to Turner Prize Nominee Susan Philipsz—That the Parliament congratulates artist Susan Philipsz on her nomination for this year’s Turner Prize; recognises that she is one of four artists in the running for the 2010 award; notes that her work, Lowlands, commissioned for the Glasgow International Festival of Visual Art, is a new site-specific outdoor sound work played on the banks of the River Clyde, and wishes the Glasgow-born artist every success for the competition.
S3M-6260 Congratulations to Turner Prize Nominee Susan Philipsz (lodged on 5 May 2010) Jim Tolson*, Patricia Ferguson*, Marlyn Glen*, Des McNulty*, Claire Baker*, Mary Mulligan*, Robin Harper*
S3M-6260 Congratulations to Turner Prize Nominee Susan Philipsz (lodged on 5 May 2010) Bob Doris*, Jackie Baillie*, Margaret Curran*, Rhona Brankin*
S3M-6260 Congratulations to Turner Prize Nominee Susan Philipsz (lodged on 5 May 2010) Jamie Hepburn*
